triples.evidence: Furthermore, an adaptive Vblcountermeasure is proposed for 3D NAND memory arrays, which can significantly minimize the NWI of triple-level cells (TLC) in all state combinations.
NAND flash memory, as a non-volatile memory device, is the most widely used data storage method in modern sensor systems due to its fast access.
This suggests that a higher bitline voltage (Vbl) transmitted by the channel potential can restore the local DIBL effect, which is ever weakened by NWI.
Furthermore, an adaptive Vblcountermeasure is proposed for 3D NAND memory arrays, which can significantly minimize the NWI of triple-level cells (TLC) in all state combinations.

axioms: impacts rdfs:domain InternalFirmwareAndLogic/DataPath/Error Correction (ECC); rdfs:range InternalFirmwareAndLogic/DataPath/Error Correction (ECC).
improves rdfs:domain InternalFirmwareAndLogic/ThermalManagement/Thermal Throttling; rdfs:range InternalFirmwareAndLogic/DataPath/Error Correction (ECC).

mappings.notes: NWI is a specific interference issue related to data path and error correction.

mappings.notes: Adaptive bitline voltage is a control mechanism similar to thermal throttling.
